en: Whether you win or lose, you should play fairly.
zh: 无论输赢，都要公平竞争。

en: Do your best whether you win or lose.
zh: 不管输赢，尽力就好。

en: If you win, you are in the right, but if you lose, you are in the wrong.
zh: 赢了你就是对的，输了你就是错的。

en: Success is never blamed.
zh: 成功了就不会有人指责。

en: We have no expectations of victory.
zh: 我们没指望能赢。

en: We have no chance of winning.
zh: 我们没机会赢了。

en: There's an outside chance of winning.
zh: 还是有那么一点点赢的机会。

en: Some will gain, others will lose.
zh: 有人会赢，也就有人会输。

en: You must keep up your guard even after a victory.
zh: 赢了之后也得保持警惕。

en: Whether you win or lose, you must play fair.
zh: 无论输赢，你都得公平竞争。

en: The chances of victory or defeat are even.
zh: 胜负的可能性各占一半。

en: Best of luck in your tournament.
zh: 祝你比赛好运。

en: The scar shows clearly.
zh: 这道疤痕很明显。

en: Let me see your wound.
zh: 让我看看你的伤口。

en: The wound discharged pus.
zh: 伤口流脓了。

en: Blood ran from the wound.
zh: 血从伤口流了出来。

en: Don't touch the wound.
zh: 别碰伤口。

en: Search not the wound too deep lest thou make a new one.
zh: 别把伤口挖得太深，省得又添新伤。

en: To avoid spoiling, fish caught far out at sea are immediately cooled or even frozen.
zh: 为了不让鱼变质，远洋捕获的鱼会立刻降温甚至冷冻。

en: When out at sea, to keep the fish that is caught from spoiling, it is immediately refrigerated.
zh: 在海上捕鱼时，为了不让鱼坏掉，会马上进行冷藏。

en: The wound was fatal to him.
zh: 那个伤口对他来说是致命的。

en: The wound has not yet healed.
zh: 伤口还没愈合呢。

en: The wound is not yet healed.
zh: 伤口还没长好。

en: The injured bird fell to the ground.
zh: 受伤的小鸟掉在了地上。

en: Pus has formed in the wound.
zh: 伤口化脓了。

en: Stop the flow of blood from the wound.
zh: 给伤口止下血。

en: Do something about the flow of blood from the wound.
zh: 想办法止住伤口流的血。

en: The wound won't close.
zh: 伤口一直合不上。

en: I was aching from the injury.
zh: 我被伤处疼得够呛。

en: Will I have a scar?
zh: 会留疤吗？

en: Call a spade a spade.
zh: 有啥说啥。

en: By degrees the friendship between him and her grew into love.
zh: 他俩的友谊渐渐变成了爱情。

en: How does the preface run?
zh: 序言是怎么写的？

en: In the introduction, the author is stating as follows.
zh: 作者在引言里是这么说的。

en: All the girls around her say she's got it coming.
zh: 她身边的女孩都说她是自找的。

en: The actress tore up her contract angrily.
zh: 那个女演员气得撕毁了合同。

en: The actress fell backward over the stage.
zh: 那个女演员在舞台上向后摔倒了。

en: The actress fell backwards from the stage.
zh: 那个女演员从舞台上仰面摔了下来。

en: My wife's hands are slightly smaller than the shop assistant's.
zh: 我老婆的手比那个店员的手稍微小一点。

en: Many times, a hen-pecked husband doesn't know his problems until he talks to a happy bachelor.
zh: 很多时候，怕老婆的男人直到和快乐的单身汉聊过之后，才意识到自己的问题。

en: A bad wife is the shipwreck of her husband.
zh: 娶个坏老婆，丈夫这辈子就毁了。

en: Were you shouting at my wife?
zh: 你刚才是在对我老婆吼吗？

en: My wife burst into tears.
zh: 我老婆突然大哭起来。

en: Knowing very well that his wife wanted to go to a movie, the husband, who was a dog in the manger, cooked up a scheme whereby they had to stay at home waiting for a certain visitor who was not expected to come.
zh: 明知道老婆想去看电影，那个自私的丈夫却耍了个花招，让他们只能留在家里等一个根本不会来的客人。

en: The shopwoman showed me a lot of neckties, but I didn't like any of them.
zh: 女店员给我看了很多领带，但我一条都没看中。

en: The maid was totally tired of her household routine.
zh: 那个女佣彻底厌倦了那些家务琐事。

en: Can't you just picture Ed in woman's disguise?
zh: 你能想象埃德扮成女人的样子吗？

en: The changes resulting from the women's movement have affected both women and men.
zh: 妇女运动带来的改变影响了每一个人，不论男女。

en: Never keep a lady waiting.
zh: 千万别让女士久等。

en: There were few colleges to educate women.
zh: 以前供女性就读的大学很少。

en: Women are easily moved to tears.
zh: 女人挺容易流泪的。

en: Women have been resigned to unjust treatment for too long.
zh: 女性忍受不公平待遇的时间太长了。

en: Women automatically lose interest in him after exchanging a couple of words.
zh: 跟他聊上几句后，女人们往往就会对他失去兴趣。

en: Women usually live longer than men.
zh: 女人通常比男人活得久。

en: Women commonly live longer than men.
zh: 一般来说，女人比男人长寿。

en: It is said that women live longer than men.
zh: 据说女人比男人活得长。

en: Women tend to live longer than men.
zh: 女人往往比男人更长寿。

en: Women are employed at a lower salary than men.
zh: 雇佣女性的工资往往比男性低。

en: Women want equality of opportunity with men.
zh: 女性想要和男性拥有平等的机会。

en: Women are physically weaker than men.
zh: 女性的体力通常比男性弱一些。

en: Women use talking to maintain personal relationships.
zh: 女性通过聊天来维持人际关系。

en: Since women are taking on more responsibilities at work and in the community, it is said that the number of women with stress from both child-rearing and work is increasing.
zh: 由于女性在工作和社区中承担了更多责任，据说兼顾带娃和工作的压力大的女性正变得越来越多。

en: Must the woman always play the secondary role?
zh: 女性非得一直扮演配角吗？

en: Women are said to be weak at figures.
zh: 都说女性对数字不太敏感。

en: Men usually like wrestling as women do not.
zh: 男人通常喜欢摔跤，而女人则不喜欢。

en: Women no longer are satisfied with their traditional role of housewife, and are seeking recognition of needs in the workplace.
zh: 女性不再满足于传统的家庭主妇角色，而是希望在职场上获得认可。

en: Women generally live longer than men.
zh: 女人普遍比男人活得久。

en: Why aren't women allowed to enjoy the same civil rights as men?
zh: 凭什么不让女性享有和男性一样的公民权利？

en: Most women enjoy shopping.
zh: 大多数女人都喜欢逛街。

en: Women tend to fuss over trifling matters.
zh: 女人总爱在小事上计较。

en: "I forgot," she answered.
zh: “我忘了，”她回答道。

en: She wanted to know if the photographer could remove the hat from the picture.
zh: 她想知道摄影师能不能把照片里的帽子修掉。

en: The position of women, over the years, has definitely changed for the better.
zh: 这些年来，女性的地位确实有了明显的提高。

en: Woman's intuition is clearly a valuable trait.
zh: 女人的直觉显然是一种很有用的特质。

en: Do you have any sisters?
zh: 你有姐妹吗？

en: Women's rights groups are going after sexual harassment.
zh: 女权团体正在打击性骚扰行为。

en: How about holding a debate on women's rights?
zh: 办一场关于妇女权利的辩论赛怎么样？

en: We should not ask a woman her age.
zh: 我们不该问女人的年龄。

en: Women talk about trivial things when talking with men.
zh: 女人和男人聊天时总爱聊些琐碎的小事。

en: Some women are quick at figures.
zh: 有些女人对数字反应挺快的。

en: Woman as she is, she can lift this barbell.
zh: 虽说是个女的，她也能举起这个杠铃。

en: A woman is giving a book a quick once-over.
zh: 一个女人正在快速翻看一本书。

en: It is quite common for women to go out to work.
zh: 现在女性出门工作是很普遍的事。

en: A woman was driving a car on a country road.
zh: 一个女人正开车行驶在乡间小路上。

en: What accounts for the fact that women outlive men?
zh: 怎么解释女人比男人活得长这件事？

en: I wonder why women outlive men.
zh: 我在想为什么女人比男人长寿。

en: I wonder why women live longer than men.
zh: 我纳闷为什么女人活得比男人久。

en: It took some 150 years of struggling for women to gain the freedom they have today.
zh: 女性奋斗了大约150年才获得今天的自由。

en: A woman is taking down some notes on a pad of paper.
zh: 一个女人正拿着便签本做记录。

en: Career opportunities, flex-time, satellite offices, and more childcare facilities are required to make women at home join the work force.
zh: 为了让家庭妇女重返职场，需要更多的就业机会、弹性工时、远程办公点以及更多的托儿设施。

en: A woman's mind and winter wind change oft.
zh: 女人的心，冬天的风，说变就变。

en: A woman's mind and winter wind change often.
zh: 女人的心思像冬天的风一样善变。

en: A woman is a weathercock.
zh: 女人的心思就像风向标一样。

en: An office girl was robbed of an envelope containing 100,000 yen on her way back from the bank.
zh: 一个女职员从银行回来的路上，被抢走了一个装有10万日元的信封。

en: Where is the ladies' room? I want to wash my hands.
zh: 女厕所在哪？我想洗个手。

en: The women's college had a very small car park, and as several of the teachers and students, and many of the student's boyfriends, had cars, it was often difficult to find a place to park.
zh: 这所女子学院的停车场特别小，因为好几个老师、学生，还有不少学生的男朋友都有车，所以经常很难找车位。

en: She was even more surprised when she heard Miss Baker say, "Excuse me, but may I change places with you?"
zh: 当她听到贝克小姐说“打扰一下，我能和你换个位置吗？”时，她感到更吃惊了。

en: Three cheers for my Queen!
zh: 为我的女王欢呼三声！

en: May the queen live long!
zh: 愿女王长寿！

en: Long live the Queen!
zh: 女王万岁！

en: The Queen is to visit China next year.
zh: 女王明年要访问中国。

en: The queen is going to address parliament next week.
zh: 女王下周要在议会发表演讲。

en: The queen visited the museum.
zh: 女王参观了博物馆。

en: The queen shook hands with each player after the game.
zh: 比赛结束后，女王和每位球员都握了手。

en: The Queen made an address to the nation on television yesterday.
zh: 昨天女王在电视上发表了全国讲话。

en: The Queen made an address to the nation.
zh: 女王发表了全国讲话。

en: The queen was richly appareled.
zh: 女王穿着非常华丽。

en: The queen was gracious enough to invite us.
zh: 女王人很好，还邀请了我们。

en: The queen was wearing a magnificent silver dress.
zh: 女王穿着一件漂亮的银色礼服。

en: The part of the queen does not suit her.
zh: 她不适合演女王这个角色。

en: An exhibition was given in anticipation of the Queen's visit.
zh: 为了迎接女王的访问，专门举办了一个展览。

en: They named the ship Queen Mary after the Queen.
zh: 他们用女王的名字把这艘船命名为“玛丽女王号”。

en: A woman is the woe of man.
zh: 女人是男人的克星。

en: Women ought to be as glad to be women as men are to be men.
zh: 女人应该像男人庆幸自己是男人那样，为身为女性而感到高兴。

en: The woman tried on one hat after another, then left the hat shop.
zh: 那个女人试了一个又一个帽子，然后就离开帽子店了。

en: She rides to the black sabbath.
zh: 她骑行去参加黑色安息日。

en: She had nothing else to drink.
zh: 她没别的东西可喝了。

en: The woman reached for the knife on the table.
zh: 那个女人伸手去拿桌上的刀。

en: Women like to talk.
zh: 女人都喜欢聊天。

en: For a girl, after 30, it's downhill all the way.
zh: 对女孩子来说，过了30岁就开始走下坡路了。

en: A woman's hair is long; her tongue is longer.
zh: 女人头发长，舌头更长。

en: How happy you must be to have a new baby girl!
zh: 你添了个小女儿，一定很高兴吧！

en: A woman was hanging the washing on the line.
zh: 一个女人正在晾衣服。

en: A woman was kind enough to show me the way.
zh: 有位好心的女士给我指了路。

en: The girls objected to our plan.
zh: 那些女孩子反对我们的计划。

en: The girls burst into laughter when they heard his joke.
zh: 听了他的笑话，那些女孩子哄堂大笑。

en: All the girls helped each other.
zh: 所有女孩子都在互相帮助。

en: Where are the girls?
zh: 女孩子们在哪儿呢？

en: The girls began to laugh when they heard the story.
zh: 听了这个故事，那些女孩子开始笑了起来。

en: The girls amused themselves playing games.
zh: 那些女孩子玩游戏玩得很开心。

en: The girls couldn't wait to show off their fine needle work to us.
zh: 那些女孩子等不及要向我们展示她们精细的针线活了。

en: The girl came dancing toward me.
zh: 那个女孩跳着舞朝我走来。

en: The girls were not afraid, but the boys were.
zh: 女孩子们不害怕，男孩子们倒怕了。

en: The girl wore yellow ribbons in her hair.
zh: 那个女孩头上扎着黄色的丝带。

en: The girl insisted on being taken to the zoo.
zh: 那个小女孩坚持要人带她去动物园。

en: Girls mature faster than boys.
zh: 女孩子比男孩子成熟得早。

en: The girl hugged her doll.
zh: 那个小女孩抱着她的洋娃娃。

en: The girl didn't like to wash dishes.
zh: 那个女孩不喜欢洗碗。

en: The girl broke into tears.
zh: 那个女孩一下子哭了出来。

en: Girls use makeup in their low teens.
zh: 女孩子十几岁就开始化妆了。

en: Almost all girls are kind.
zh: 几乎所有的女孩子都很善良。

en: Girls think much of fashion.
zh: 女孩子都很在意时尚。

en: The girls are facing each other.
zh: 那些女孩子正面对面站着。

en: Girls like to show off their fine clothes.
zh: 女孩子喜欢炫耀她们漂亮的衣服。

en: The girl was called Elizabeth after her grandmother.
zh: 那个女孩随她祖母的名字，也叫伊丽莎白。

en: Both girls wear white suits.
zh: 两个女孩子都穿着白色套装。

en: Both of the girls are wearing white suits.
zh: 两个女孩子都穿着白色套装。

en: Some of the girls like that sort of music, and some don't.
zh: 有些女孩子喜欢那种音乐，有些则不喜欢。

en: Bob felt embarrassed when he was treated in front of some girls.
zh: 鲍勃在一些女孩子面前被请客时感到很尴尬。

en: A little girl caught her fingers in the door.
zh: 一个小女孩的手指被门夹住了。

en: Jeans are now in fashion among girls.
zh: 现在女孩子挺流行穿牛仔裤的。

en: There is no stopping a girl's tongue.
zh: 女孩子的话匣子一打开就停不下来。

en: What he said about girls holds true of boys, too.
zh: 他说的那些关于女孩子的话，对男孩子也一样适用。

en: Girl as she was, Joan was not daunted at all.
zh: 虽然是个女孩子，但琼一点也没被吓住。

en: Keep an eye on the girls.
zh: 盯着点那些女孩子。

en: Keep an eye on the girls; they are poor swimmers.
zh: 盯着点那些女孩子，她们不太会游泳。

en: I saw a girl tumble and ran to her in spite of myself.
zh: 我看到个女孩摔了一跤，不由自主地就跑向她。

en: The girl was heard to sing a song.
zh: 有人听到那个女孩子在唱歌。

en: A girl should not sit with her legs crossed.
zh: 女孩子不应该翘着腿坐。

en: A girl gave me an orange in exchange for a piece of cake.
zh: 一个女孩子拿了个橘子跟我换了一块蛋糕。

en: A woman's strength is in her tongue.
zh: 女人的厉害之处就在于她的那张嘴。

en: A woman asked me for directions.
zh: 有个女人向我问路。

en: Woman as she was, she was brave.
zh: 虽然是个女人，但她非常勇敢。

en: A woman thinks of everything in terms of money.
zh: 女人干什么都爱往钱上想。

en: Women are always buying hats.
zh: 女人们老是在买帽子。

en: Three women and a goose make a market.
zh: 三个女人一台戏。

en: We want an assistant, preferably someone with experience.
zh: 我们想招个助理，最好是有经验的。

en: An expert was called for advice.
zh: 请了位专家来提供建议。

en: I tried to give him some advice, but he just abused me violently.
zh: 我想给他点建议，他却把我臭骂了一顿。

en: Advice isn't much good to me. I need money.
zh: 建议对我没啥用，我缺的是钱。

en: It is important to help each other.
zh: 互相帮助很重要。

en: Give help to anyone who needs it.
zh: 谁需要帮助就帮谁。

en: I heard a cry for help.
zh: 我听到了求救声。

en: Please send for help.
zh: 请快找人帮忙。

en: A call for help rang through the night.
zh: 黑夜里传来一声求救。

en: There is no use crying for help. No one will hear you.
zh: 喊救命也没用，没人听得见。

en: There's no use crying for help. No one will hear you.
zh: 喊救命也没用，没人听得见。

en: I had trouble making him hear me calling for help.
zh: 我费了好大劲才让他听到我的求救声。

en: It is our obligation to help.
zh: 帮助别人是我们的义务。

en: It's our duty to help.
zh: 帮助别人是我们的职责。

en: Is there any help available?
zh: 还有人能帮忙吗？

en: Thank you for your help.
zh: 谢谢你的帮助。

en: Will you help me?
zh: 你能帮我一下吗？

en: I took him out to dinner in return for his help.
zh: 为了答谢他的帮助，我请他吃了顿饭。

en: Help me.
zh: 帮帮我。

en: Help me, please.
zh: 请帮我一下。

en: Help me!
zh: 帮帮我！

en: I am very much obliged to you for your help.
zh: 真的很感谢你的帮助。

en: You've got to help me! Every night I have the same horrible dream.
zh: 你一定要帮帮我！我每天晚上都做同一个噩梦。

en: I want to express my appreciation for your help.
zh: 我想对你的帮助表示感谢。

en: Help!
zh: 救命！

en: Let's endure till help comes.
zh: 咱们再坚持下，等到救援来。

en: Call on me if you need my assistance.
zh: 有需要帮忙的尽管找我。

en: Call me if you need my assistance.
zh: 需要帮忙就给我打电话。

en: Call me if you need my help.
zh: 有需要的话就给我打电话。

en: Call me if you need assistance.
zh: 有需要就找我。

en: Call me if you need help.
zh: 需要帮忙就叫我。

en: You have to pay for utilities.
zh: 水电费你得自己交。

en: The facts bear out this hypothesis.
zh: 事实证明了这个假设。

en: All of you have to read it.
zh: 你们所有人都得读一下。

en: You should work in the interests of humanity.
zh: 你应该为全人类的利益而工作。

en: Are you going to learn English?
zh: 你打算学英语吗？

en: The first thing you must learn is to stand on your own ideas.
zh: 你首先得学会坚持自己的主见。

en: Gentlemen, allow me to say a few words in greeting.
zh: 各位，请允许我讲几句欢迎的话。

en: Will you hand the papers around?
zh: 能帮着发一下这些文件吗？

en: Keep the paper in the inside pocket.
zh: 把纸放在内口袋里。

en: All the papers were taped up and kept in the safe.
zh: 所有的文件都封好存放在保险柜里了。

en: The documents were tampered with.
zh: 这些文件被人动过手脚了。

en: Have you finished the papers?
zh: 文件处理完了吗？

en: Please don't take the documents out of this room.
zh: 请不要把文件带出这个房间。

en: Sign your name at the end of the paper.
zh: 在纸的末尾签上你的名字。

en: Divide the pile of documents equally, and take them one by one to either side of the room.
zh: 把这叠文件平分，然后一张一张地放到房间两边。

en: The papers blew off.
zh: 纸被吹跑了。

en: Apply in writing.
zh: 请提交书面申请。

en: So valuable were books that the greatest care was taken of them.
zh: 以前书非常贵重，大家都保存得很仔细。

en: Books add to the pleasures of life.
zh: 读书能增加生活乐趣。

en: We can derive great pleasure from books.
zh: 我们可以从书本中获得很大的快乐。

en: If it were not for books, each generation would have to rediscover for itself the truths of the past.

en: Everywhere looks beautiful in the spring.
zh: 春天到处都很美。

en: In spring it becomes warmer and warmer.
zh: 春天天气变得越来越暖和。

en: Every spring, the winter ice melts into the streams and rivers and lakes.
zh: 每年春天，冬天的积冰都会融化，流进溪流和江河湖泊。

en: In spring, everyone wakes up early.
zh: 春天大家都起得早。

en: When spring arrives, I'm going to take up a new sport.
zh: 等春天到了，我打算开始一项新运动。

en: I look forward to seeing them this spring.
zh: 我很期待今年春天能见到他们。

en: When spring arrives, I am going to take up a new sport.
zh: 春天一到，我打算去练个新运动。

en: It was a little too muggy for spring.
zh: 作为春天来说，这天气有点太闷热了。

en: Autumn is suitable for study, compared with spring.
zh: 跟春天比起来，秋天更适合学习。

en: Which do you prefer, spring or autumn?
zh: 你更喜欢春天还是秋天？

en: Let's contrast spring with fall.
zh: 咱们把春天和秋天对比一下。

en: Which do you like better, spring or autumn?
zh: 春天和秋天，你更喜欢哪一个？

en: It was springtime... and everything was quiet and peaceful in the country.
zh: 那是春天……乡下的一切都显得特别宁静平和。

en: Love begins playing his old tricks every spring.
zh: 每到春天，爱情又开始耍它那套老把戏了。

en: When spring comes, it gets warm.
zh: 春天一到，天气就变暖和了。

en: Everything in the fields and mountains looks fresh when spring comes.
zh: 春天一到，漫山遍野看着都特别清新。

en: In the spring, when the days grew longer and the sun warmer, she waited for the first robin to return from the south.
zh: 春天白昼变长、太阳变暖的时候，她就在等第一只知更鸟从南方飞回来。

en: The snow melted away when spring came.
zh: 春天来了，雪都化了。

en: When spring comes, people go out to pick wild plants.
zh: 春天到了，大家都去野外挖野菜。

en: When spring comes, the days get longer day by day.
zh: 春天来了，白天一天比一天长了。

en: I'm looking forward to the return of spring.
zh: 我特别期待春天快点回来。

en: Do you like spring or autumn?
zh: 你喜欢春天还是秋天？

en: Spring is drawing near.
zh: 春天近了。

en: Spring came on.
zh: 春天来了。

en: Spring has come around.
zh: 春天又到了。

en: Spring is coming soon.
zh: 春天快要来了。

en: Spring is here. It is getting warmer every day.
zh: 春天到了，天气一天比一天暖和。

en: We are doing business at piecework payment basis.
zh: 我们是按件计酬的。

en: The turnover was 500 million shares.
zh: 成交量是五亿股。

en: I'll be back by tomorrow, if possible.
zh: 如果可能的话，我明天回来。

en: I'd like to make a reservation to play golf tomorrow.
zh: 我想预订明天打高尔夫。

en: I would like to, but I have a previous appointment.
zh: 我想去，但我已经有约了。

en: I'd like to go fishing if possible.
zh: 如果可以的话，我想去钓鱼。

en: I'll try to finish it in time as best I can.
zh: 我会尽力按时完成的。

en: I'll try my best to finish it in time.
zh: 我会尽全力准时搞定。

en: Lend me what money you can.
zh: 能借我多少就借我多少吧。

en: Lend me as much money you can.
zh: 尽量多借我点钱。

en: As far as I can, I'll help you.
zh: 我会尽力帮你的。

en: I think I can.
zh: 我觉得我行。

en: Try to read as many books as possible.
zh: 尽量多读点书。

en: We have to avoid a conflict as far as possible.
zh: 我们要尽量避免冲突。

en: We want the meeting arranged as soon as possible.
zh: 我们想尽快安排会议。

en: I will pay my debt as soon as possible.
zh: 我会尽快还债。

en: Do it as soon as possible.
zh: 尽快去做吧。

en: Please give us your answer as soon as possible.
zh: 请尽快给我们答复。

en: I will write to you as soon as I can.
zh: 我会尽快给你写信。

en: I will make up for the lost time by studying as hard as I can.
zh: 我要尽量刻苦学习，把失去的时间补回来。

en: I'd like inexpensive seats, if possible.
zh: 如果可以的话，我想要便宜点的位子。

en: Please speak as slowly as possible.
zh: 请尽量说慢一点。

en: Please write to me as soon as you can.
zh: 请尽快给我回信。

en: Please speak as clearly as you can.
zh: 请尽量说清楚点。

en: I would like to have a look at your collection of stamps.
zh: 我想看看你收藏的邮票。

en: Skip the problems you can not do and go ahead.
zh: 不会做的题就先跳过，继续往下做。

en: Will you please order a copy of the book from the publisher?
zh: 能帮我向出版社订一本书吗？

en: All the arrangements should be made prior to our departure.
zh: 出发前要把所有的事都安排好。

en: I'd like to settle the transportation arrangements before I leave.
zh: 我想在走之前把交通的事安排好。

en: I'd like to confirm the departure time.
zh: 我想确认一下出发时间。

en: What is the departure time?
zh: 出发时间是几点？

en: What's the departure time?
zh: 什么时候出发？

en: There still is time until leaving.
zh: 离出发还有点时间。

en: What time do we leave?
zh: 我们几点走？

en: Are you ready to start?
zh: 准备好开始了吗？

en: Are you ready to set off?
zh: 准备好出发了吗？

en: I'm all set to start.
zh: 我都准备好可以开始了。

en: I'm ready to leave.
zh: 我准备好可以走了。

en: I'm ready to depart.
zh: 我准备好要出发了。

en: Call me before you leave.
zh: 你走之前给我打个电话。

en: I would like to see you before I leave.
zh: 我走之前想见见你。

en: It is really time for us to go.
zh: 咱们真的该走了。

en: Hardly had I started when it began to rain.
zh: 我刚准备走就开始下雨了。

en: Scarcely had I started out when it began to rain.
zh: 我刚出发就开始下雨了。

en: They said they'd make the boarding announcement 20 minutes before takeoff.
zh: 他们说起飞前20分钟会通知登机。

en: The gate was left open.
zh: 门没关，一直开着。

en: I took advantage of my business trip to see the sights of Paris.
zh: 我趁着出差的机会去巴黎转了转。

en: How was the attendance?
zh: 来了多少人？

en: Do you have many out-of-town assignments?
zh: 你外派任务多吗？

en: Do you often take business trips?
zh: 你经常出差吗？

en: Your attendance will affect your final grade.
zh: 你的出勤情况会影响期末成绩。

en: Those present were fewer than we had expected.
zh: 到场的人比我们预想的要少。

en: Those present were charmed by her beauty.
zh: 在场的人都被她的美貌给迷住了。

en: Those present were all against the plan.
zh: 在场的人都反对那个计划。

en: Those present were so kind.
zh: 在场的人都特别友好。

en: Those present were almost all women.
zh: 在场的人几乎全是女性。

en: Those present took it for genuine gold.
zh: 在场的人都把它当成了真金。

en: Those who were there thought it was pure gold.
zh: 在场的人都以为那是纯金的。

en: Those present rose as one man and walked out.
zh: 在场的人齐刷刷地站起来走了出去。

en: There were forty people present.
zh: 当时有40个人在场。

en: Among those present was the Mayor.
zh: 市长当时也在场。

en: Among those present was our principal.
zh: 我们校长当时也在。

en: There was no objection on the part of those present.
zh: 在场的人都没有异议。

en: She was the brightest and gayest of all present.
zh: 她是所有在场的人里最亮眼、最活泼的一个。

en: Attendance had been falling off and such people as did come sat about indifferently.
zh: 到场的人越来越少，来的人也都坐那儿一副无动于衷的样子。

en: Those who are present are all Japanese.
zh: 在场的都是日本人。

en: You can't attend? Why not?
zh: 你去不了？为什么？

en: Please let me know by Wednesday if you can't attend.
zh: 如果你去不了，请在周三前告诉我。

en: I will join it!
zh: 我会参加的！

en: I'll attend.
zh: 我会去的。

en: You ought not to miss it.
zh: 你一定不能错过。

en: Those present were all astonished at the results of the election.
zh: 在场的人都对选举结果感到震惊。

en: All the people present were moved by his speech.
zh: 在场的人都被他的演讲感动了。

en: The people present were surprised.
zh: 在场的人都很惊讶。

en: Those present were, for the most part, students.
zh: 在场的大多都是学生。

en: The birth rate and death rate were nearly equal.
zh: 出生率和死亡率几乎持平。

en: The mortality rate per 1000 live births are set out in figure 13.1.
zh: 图13.1显示了每千名新生儿的死亡率。

en: If you are to succeed in life, work harder.
zh: 想要出人头地，就得更努力。

en: You have to be aggressive to be a success.
zh: 要想成功，你得有股闯劲儿。

en: If you wish to get on in the world, you must not shrink from effort.
zh: 如果你想在社会上立足，就不能怕吃苦。

en: Luck and hard work are necessary if you want to advance in life.
zh: 想要有出息，运气和努力缺一不可。

en: Damages from the flood amount to ten million dollars.
zh: 洪水造成的损失高达一千万美元。

en: He always talks as though he knows how to handle himself but you never know how he'll act when the chips are down.
zh: 他总表现得很有主见，但到了关键时刻谁知道他会怎么做。

en: When I got to the office, I had tons of work waiting for me. I was running around like a chicken with its head cut off.
zh: 我一到办公室就有一堆活儿等着我，忙得跟没头苍蝇似的。

en: Where is the way out?
zh: 出路在哪里？

en: Something has to be done to stop the bleeding.
zh: 必须得采取点措施止损了。

en: Do you have any bleeding?
zh: 你有流血吗？

en: I've started bleeding.
zh: 我开始流血了。

en: It won't stop bleeding.
zh: 血止不住。

en: I'm bleeding badly.
zh: 我流了好多血。

en: Thank you for coming to meet me.
zh: 谢谢你来见我。

en: Would you please let me know the delivery time?
zh: 麻烦告诉我一下发货时间。

en: Thank you very much if the shipment has already been made and please disregard this inquiry.
zh: 如果已经发货了，非常感谢，请忽略这条信息。

en: Thank you very much for informing me that the shipment will be delayed.
zh: 谢谢你通知我发货会延迟。

en: Thank you for the shipment.
zh: 谢谢你发货。

en: In case of fire, you should dial 119 immediately.
zh: 万一发生火灾，要立刻拨打119。

en: In case of fire, push the button.
zh: 万一发生火灾，请按这个按钮。

en: The fire must have broken out after the staff had gone home.
zh: 火肯定是员工们下班回家后才烧起来的。

en: The fire must've broken out after the staff had gone home.
zh: 火肯定是员工们下班回家后才烧起来的。

en: The cast was given a standing ovation.
zh: 演员们赢得了全场起立鼓掌。

en: The nail that sticks up gets hammered down.
zh: 枪打出头鸟。

en: The nail that sticks out gets hammered down.
zh: 枪打出头鸟。

en: Envy is the companion of honour.
zh: 荣誉往往伴随着嫉妒。

en: The stake that sticks out gets hammered down.
zh: 枪打出头鸟。

en: A company that stifles innovation can't hope to grow very much.
zh: 扼杀创新的公司没什么发展前景。

en: Be sure to put the fire out before you leave.
zh: 走之前一定要把火熄灭。

en: Either go out or come in.
zh: 要么出去，要么进来。

en: I was about to leave when Mary appeared out of the blue.
zh: 我正要走，玛丽就突然出现了。

en: Get out!

en: Get outta here!

en: Get lost.
zh: 滚远点。

en: You are free to leave any time you wish.
zh: 你随时都可以走。

en: I had scarcely gone out before the phone rang.
zh: 我刚出门，电话就响了。

en: Get your carcass out of here!

en: Please leave.
zh: 请离开。

en: The man who stepped out was frowning.
zh: 走出来的那个男人皱着眉头。

en: Making a good start is half the battle.
zh: 良好的开端是成功的一半。

en: Hand it over. That's all you've got?

en: If you give at all, give quickly.
zh: 要给就快点给。

en: Let me out!
zh: 放我出去！

en: Let me out.
zh: 让我出去。

en: Take it out!
zh: 拿出来！

en: Could you let it out?
zh: 能把它放出来吗？

en: You must eat what you are served.
zh: 给什么你就得吃什么。

en: I'll come as soon as I can.
zh: 我一有空就来。

en: I'll come as soon as possible.
zh: 我会尽快赶来。

en: I want you to have a definite plan before you leave.
zh: 我希望你走之前能有个明确的计划。

en: Don't forget to turn off the gas before going out.
zh: 出门前别忘了关煤气。

en: Be sure to put out the light before you go out.
zh: 出门前记得把灯关了。

en: Please be sure to turn off the light before you leave.
zh: 走之前请务必关灯。

en: You want to eat before you go.
zh: 你想吃了再走。

en: You have to eat before you go.
zh: 你得吃了再走。

en: I've got to shave before leaving.
zh: 我走之前得刮个胡子。

en: Make sure that the lights are turned off before you leave.
zh: 走之前确认一下灯都关了。

en: Are you sure you don't want to use the toilet before you go?
zh: 你确定走之前不去上个厕所吗？

en: See that the door is locked before you leave.
zh: 走之前看看门锁好没。

en: You should make sure of it before you go.
zh: 你走之前最好确认一下。

en: Make sure you turn everything off before you leave.
zh: 走之前记得把该关的都关了。

en: I think I still have time for another cup of coffee.
zh: 我觉得我还有时间再喝杯咖啡。

en: Be sure to turn off the gas before you go out.
zh: 出门前一定要把煤气关了。

en: I would like another cup of tea before I go.
zh: 我走之前想再喝杯茶。

en: I'd like another cup of tea before I go.
zh: 我走之前想再喝杯茶。

en: Please lock the door before you go out.
zh: 出门前请记得锁门。

en: It's time to go.
zh: 该走了。

en: Time to go.
zh: 该走了。

en: Are you ready to go out?

en: It was time to leave.
zh: 到该走的时候了。

en: Be sure to turn out the light when you go out.
zh: 出门记得把灯关了。

en: Are you ready to go?
zh: 准备好要走了吗？

en: I would sooner stay than go.
zh: 我宁愿留下也不想走。

en: I'd rather stay than go.
zh: 我宁愿留下也不想走。

en: I wish you would shut the door when you go out.
zh: 希望你出门的时候能把门带上。

en: I was about to go out, when he came to see me.
zh: 我正要出门，他就来看我了。

en: I was about to go out when he came to see me.
zh: 我刚要出门，他就过来了。

en: We were about to start, when it began to rain.
zh: 我们正准备出发，天就下雨了。

en: I was about to leave home when the telephone rang.
zh: 我正要出门，电话就响了。

en: I was about to go out when he called on me.
zh: 我刚准备出门，他就来找我了。

en: Don't you want to go out?
zh: 你不想出去吗？

en: Somebody came to see me while I was out.
zh: 我不在家的时候有人来找过我。

en: You may as well leave now.
zh: 你还是现在走吧。

en: A skilled mechanic earns decent wages.
zh: 技术好的技工挣得挺多的。

en: Even expert drivers can make mistakes.
zh: 就算是老司机也会犯错。

en: A good salesman will not encroach on his customer's time.
zh: 好的推销员不会占用客户太多的时间。

en: Eat green fruit and ten to one you will get ill.
zh: 吃没熟的水果肯定得生病。

en: A ripe apple dropped from the tree.
zh: 一个熟了的苹果从树上掉了下来。

en: I'm going to make reduced copies.
zh: 我打算去弄点缩印件。

en: Yoshiko is an Anzai.
zh: 佳子姓安斋。

en: Does the price include accommodation?
zh: 价格包含住宿吗？

en: Let me know where you're staying.
zh: 告诉我你住哪儿。

en: Could you please sign the register?
zh: 请签个名。

en: Can I extend my stay one more night?
zh: 我能再多住一晚吗？

en: I'd like to stay at your hotel.
zh: 我想住你们酒店。

en: I'd like to stay here overnight.
zh: 我想在这儿住一晚。

en: Hand in your homework by next Monday.
zh: 下周一之前把作业交了。

en: Turn in your homework.
zh: 把作业交了。

en: Hand in your homework.

en: It's a relief to have finished the assignment on time.
zh: 准时把作业写完总算松了口气。

en: I have done all my homework and now I am completely free until Monday.
zh: 我作业都写完了，到下周一之前我彻底自由了。

en: I have done all of my homework and I'd like to take a short break.
zh: 我作业全写完了，想稍微歇会儿。

en: I'm thankful to you for your helping me with my homework.

en: I must get my homework finished.
zh: 我得把作业写完。

en: It took me three hours to finish the homework.
zh: 我花了三个小时才写完作业。

en: Are you through with your homework?

en: After I had done my homework, I went to bed.
zh: 我写完作业就去睡了。

en: After completing the homework, I reflected on something I had read in Truman's.
zh: 写完作业后，我思考了一下在杜鲁门书里读到的内容。

en: I will go out after I finish my homework.

en: It is very nice of you to help me with my homework.
zh: 你人真好，帮我写作业。

en: Thank you for helping me with my homework.
zh: 谢谢你帮我写作业。

en: It was very nice of you to help me with my homework.
zh: 刚才真谢谢你帮我写作业。

en: I played video games after I finished my homework.
zh: 写完作业后，我玩了会儿游戏。

en: After he had done his homework, he watched TV.
zh: 他写完作业后看了会儿电视。

en: Submit your homework on Monday.

en: Let's do the homework together.
zh: 咱们一起写作业吧。

en: You ought to have done the homework.
zh: 你本来应该把作业写了的。

en: Do your homework.

en: It took me three hours to finish my homework.
zh: 我写作业花了三个小时。

en: Having done my homework, I had a chat with Mom.
zh: 写完作业，我跟我妈聊了会儿天。

en: The boy left his homework half-finished.
zh: 那个男孩作业写了一半就不写了。

en: Having done my homework, I had a chat with Mum.
zh: 写完作业后，我跟我妈聊了会天。

en: Don't watch TV until you finish your work.
zh: 作业没写完不准看电视。

en: Our teacher gives us a lot of homework.
zh: 老师留的作业特别多。

en: I'll come when I have done my homework.
zh: 我写完作业就过去。

en: When I have finished my homework, I'll go for a swim.
zh: 等我写完作业就去游泳。

en: When I've finished my homework, I'll go for a swim.
zh: 写完作业我就去游泳。

en: She told him off for not doing his homework.
zh: 她因为他不写作业数落了他一顿。

en: I'm busy with my homework.
zh: 我正忙着写作业呢。

en: I'm busy doing homework.

en: I'm busy with homework.
zh: 我忙着作业呢。

en: Do your homework for yourself.
zh: 作业是你为你自己写的。

en: Do your homework by yourself.

en: You are supposed to hand in your homework by Friday.
zh: 你应该在周五前交作业。

en: The homework was easily done.
zh: 这作业挺好写的。

en: Are you completely through with your homework?
zh: 你作业全都写完了吗？

en: Write your homework in ink, not in pencil.
zh: 作业用签字笔写，别用铅笔。

en: Are you done with your homework yet?
zh: 你作业写完了没？

en: Have you already finished your homework?
zh: 你作业已经写完了吗？

en: Have you done your assignment yet?

zh: 居民们一直在投诉噪音问题。

en: The housing shortage is very acute.
zh: 住房短缺的情况非常严重。

en: The housing situation seemed quite hopeless.
zh: 住房情况看起来挺没戏的。

en: As far housing goes, it is very poor in Japan.
zh: 说到住房，日本那边的条件确实挺差的。

en: The housing project has fallen flat.
zh: 那个住房项目彻底黄了。

en: Housing could be obtained at a price.
zh: 只要舍得花钱，还是能弄到房子的。

en: The house costs double what it did before.
zh: 现在的房价是以前的两倍了。

en: House prices have remained static for several months.
zh: 房价这几个月都没什么动静。

en: I must bring my address book up to date.
zh: 我得把通讯录更新一下了。

en: This is to inform you of my address change. Please update your mailing list.
zh: 我搬家了，地址改了，麻烦更新一下邮寄名单。

en: Might I ask your address?
zh: 方便问一下你的地址吗？

en: I don't have the address with me.
zh: 我手头没带那个地址。

en: I don't have the address now.
zh: 我现在没有那个地址。

en: Wherever you live is the best place.
zh: 你住哪儿，哪儿就是最好的地方。

en: That is a good place to live.
zh: 那地方挺适合住人的。

en: News of the scandal caused the politician to lose face.
zh: 那桩丑闻让那个政客丢尽了脸。

en: An ugly duckling became a graceful swan.
zh: 丑小鸭变天鹅了。

en: I have difficulty concentrating.
zh: 我注意力很难集中。

en: The intensive course did marvels for my French.
zh: 那个强化班让我的法语进步神速。

en: All social animals use some methods of communication to exchange information and to maintain an orderly community.
zh: 群居动物都会通过各种方式交流，交换信息并维持群体秩序。

en: It is not clear when the meeting will open again.
zh: 目前还不清楚什么时候再开会。

en: The meeting broke up at nine o'clock.
zh: 会议九点就散了。

en: The meeting broke up at seven.
zh: 会议七点就开完了。

en: No one else came to the meeting.
zh: 没别的人来开会了。

en: Start at once so as not to be late for the meeting.
zh: 赶紧出发吧，省得开会迟到。

en: Let's get together and talk about old times.
zh: 咱们聚聚，叙叙旧吧。

en: Let's get together and talk about the matter.
zh: 咱们聚一下，商量商量这事。

en: Won't you come and see me this weekend?
zh: 这周末你来找我玩吗？

en: The chief massed his warriors to attack the fort.
zh: 首领召集了战士去攻打要塞。

en: I'd like to take a small trip this weekend.
zh: 这周末我想去短途旅游一下。

en: How was last weekend, Nancy?
zh: 南希，上周末过得怎么样？

en: What're you going to do this weekend?
zh: 你这周末打算干嘛？

en: What'll you be doing over the weekend?
zh: 你周末有什么打算？

en: How was your weekend?
zh: 周末过得怎么样？

en: What did you do over the weekend?
zh: 你周末干什么去了？

en: Are you staying there for the weekend?
zh: 你周末也待在那儿吗？

en: You won't make any progress just studying on the weekends. It's meaningless unless you do it every day.
zh: 光靠周末学是不可能有进步的，得天天练才有意义。

en: What are you going to do over the weekend?
zh: 周末你打算怎么过？

en: What are your weekend plans?
zh: 你周末有什么计划？

en: What're your plans for the weekend?
zh: 你周末打算干点啥？

en: Would you like to have supper with us on the weekend?
zh: 周末想不想跟我们一起吃个饭？

en: I think I caught a bug over the weekend.
zh: 我觉得我周末好像感冒了。

en: Do you feel like going out for a drive in the country over the weekend?
zh: 周末想不想去郊外兜兜风？

en: I spent the weekend writhing in agony when my gallstone started to move.
zh: 我周末胆结石犯了，疼得我死去活来的。

en: I pigged out over the weekend.
zh: 我周末暴饮暴食了一通。

en: The counterfeit bills flooded the market over the weekend.
zh: 周末市场上突然冒出了大量的假钞。

en: How about going for a swim this weekend?
zh: 这周末去游泳怎么样？

en: I hankered to get out of the city for a weekend.
zh: 我一直想周末能出城去透透气。

en: I often go yachting on weekends.
zh: 我周末经常去玩游艇。

en: I often go sailing on weekends.
zh: 我周末经常去玩帆船。

en: We used to visit each other on weekends.
zh: 我们以前周末经常互相串门。

en: We used to visit each other on the weekend.
zh: 我们以前周末常走动。

en: See you on the weekend.
zh: 周末见。

en: Let's go hiking this weekend.
zh: 这周末去爬山吧。

en: How about going to a disco this weekend?
zh: 这周末去蹦迪怎么样？

en: Let's visit my grandpa this weekend.
zh: 这周末去看看我爷爷吧。

en: As long as it doesn't spoil the weekend!
zh: 只要不毁了这周末就行！

en: Will you have a little time this weekend to help me with my French?
zh: 你这周末有空帮我看看法语吗？

en: I sure wish I could have a three-day weekend.
zh: 真希望周末能连休三天。

en: Is there a weekly rate?
zh: 有按周算的价钱吗？

en: You should receive them by the end of the week.
zh: 你这周末前应该能收到。

en: The latter half of the week was fine.
zh: 这周后半段挺不错的。

en: The seventh day of the week is Saturday.
zh: 一周的第七天是周六。

en: The 7th day of the week is Saturday.
zh: 一周的第七天是星期六。

en: We have four French classes a week.
zh: 我们每周有四节法语课。

en: How many times a week do you take a bath?
zh: 你一周洗几次澡？

en: How many times a week does the soccer team practice?
zh: 足球队一周训练几次？

en: Try to exercise at least once a week.
zh: 尽量每周至少锻炼一次。

en: Studying three hours a week wouldn't be enough to learn a language well.
zh: 每周只学三小时是学不好一门语言的。

en: When attacked he defended himself with an umbrella.
zh: 被攻击时，他拿雨伞自卫。

en: The number of minority seats in the Lower House is rapidly eroding.
zh: 众议院的少数派席位正在迅速减少。

en: The boat is lost.
zh: 船不见了。

en: Courage is needed to change a custom.
zh: 改变习俗需要勇气。

en: Habit is second nature.
zh: 习惯成自然。

en: Custom reconciles us to everything.
zh: 习惯了就什么都能适应了。

en: A habit is very difficult to shake off once it is formed.
zh: 习惯一旦养成，就很难改掉。

en: It is true of learning English that "practice makes perfect".
zh: 学英语确实是“熟能生巧”。

en: His English is not bad, seeing that he has studied for only two years.
zh: 考虑到他才学了两年，他的英语已经挺不错的了。

en: We are just in time for the last train.
zh: 我们正好赶上了末班车。

en: It rained on and off all day.
zh: 雨断断续续下了一整天。

en: Many passengers were sleeping on the last train.
zh: 末班车上很多乘客都在睡觉。

en: I have to hurry to the station to take the last train.
zh: 我得赶紧去车站坐末班车。

en: I have to hurry to the station to catch the last train.
zh: 我得赶紧去车站赶末班车。

en: I was able to catch the last train.
zh: 我赶上了末班车。

en: It is difficult to find a well paid permanent job.
zh: 很难找到一份高薪的稳定工作。

en: Go out and have a good time once in a while instead of just studying all the time.
zh: 别光顾着学习，偶尔也出去玩玩。

en: What time does the curtain fall?
zh: 演出几点结束？

en: All's well that ends well.
zh: 结果好，就一切都好。

en: All is well that ends well.
zh: 只要结局是好的，一切就都好。

en: I'll mail this questionnaire as soon as I finish.
zh: 我一填完问卷就寄出去。

en: You must try hard to the end.
zh: 你必须坚持到底。

en: "I've finished" said Tony shortly, then he closed the piano.
zh: “我弹完了，”托尼简短地说了句，然后合上了钢琴。

en: Have you finished?
zh: 你做完了吗？

en: Autumnal Equinox Day falls on Friday this year.
zh: 今年的秋分是周五。

en: An autumn breeze begins to blow.
zh: 秋风吹起来了。

en: Like a leaf in the autumn breeze.
zh: 就像秋风中的一片落叶。

en: I prefer spring to fall.
zh: 比起秋天，我更喜欢春天。

en: There are also people who like spring better than autumn.
zh: 也有人比起秋天更喜欢春天。

en: Autumn is the best season for reading.
zh: 秋天是最适合读书的季节。

en: Fall is a good season for reading.
zh: 秋天是个读书的好季节。
